Reviews.Title: “Re-Opening With A Flair”
Reviews.Author: jsob1949
Reviews.Content: We had spent a week down the road at an apartment but decided to stay a few extra days. We booked in Feb. 28, 2012 the first day they reopened after renos. You would not have known that just 2 days earlier it was a beehive of activity! Smaller rooms than we are use to in NA but very stylish and comfortable. Excellent staff, friendly, courtious, very willing to help and full of useful info on the immediate area and Paris in general. Very good breakfast and they have just started a Dinner Menu very tasty. For the first time visitor to Paris this is an EXCELLENT location. 5 minutes to the Arc, the metro(very easy to use) and the Champs Elysees. 15 minutes walking to the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower. Resturants, how many and how close?? Everywhere :-) 5 Star recommendation Karen & John Belanger Edmonton, Alberta Canada

Reviews.Title: “Shame”
Reviews.Author: Swissrmeadventure
Reviews.Content: Really love the look, ethos and reviews of this hotel and had hoped to stay here on our wedding night. However, it seems that you cannot book a specific room (one of the Exception rooms) upon request. That is a great shame as the other two Exception rooms, although lovely, didn't have anywhere near the same great pull as the white one did. We return to Paris each year and will maybe stay in one of their cheaper and fantastic sounding rooms another time. I just think it's a shame that you cannot reserve a particular room for very special occassions (especially as it is very close to €300 per night, including breakfast, paid up front) in what seems to be one of Paris's special hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: gmp67
Reviews.Content: This hotel promotes itself on a sustainable platform and pretty much lives up to its name. The rooms do have a strange layout and are a little claustrophobic, but the beds are bliss! Very very comfortable, though take a little getting used to at first. Hot water was intermittent which was a pain, wi fi is free - a bonus in Paris!. Staff are delightful and the express breakfast does what it says onteh tin. A pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and clean rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: Jechi P
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to stay at the Hidden Hotel. The staff was friendly, casual and nice. The room was super cosy, romantic and clean. It was not very big but still gaves us the feeling that the room was spacious. Also, the cocomat bed was very comfortable. High quality material. We had a quiet room. The bath in the room is very nice when you're a couple. However, this might be awkward if you are there with a friend. Good accessibility with public transport, quiet neighborhood. We loved our stay and would highly recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Hamelator
Reviews.Content: We were surprised about the beautiful location, beautiful design and most of all about the nice crew. They have done everything to make our stay memorable. Next time in Paris I will definitely choose the Hidden Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Alice M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the inspiration room, having only just been there was a january sale on and we got the room for half price. The room itself is small but laid out so well, good for a couple as shower is in room with a glass door, all slate with a drench shower and a seat. A large very comfy bed. large TV and generally lovely room. The Staff were friendly and helpful. Had we had more time we would have had a drink in the lounge which was so nice. Follow the directions from the tube from The hidden hotels website and it is a 5 minute walk. Amazing boulangerie around the corner not to be missed. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone, couples, business, singles. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy A
Reviews.Content: Pros: went with my family and booked 2 rooms. great location, close walk to arc de triomphe and easy access to the metro. i had printed out a google map directions and the hotel was easy to find. loved the concept and design of the hotel. the staff was very friendly and spoke very good english. Cons: the AC was wayy too hot. the shower is very revealing, its pretty much just a glass door. i understand that they are trying to use organic bed sheets, but i found the bet sheets to be a little more on the rough side. the breakfast selection was too simple and minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Super Mod, Super Convenient”
Reviews.Author: BinxieCat
Reviews.Content: Our London/Paris New Years honeymoon was on a mid-range budget, but it was important to us that we get a really nice hotel for at least one or two nights for New Years Eve. The Hidden Hotel was fated for us to find (husband and I found it online at the exact same time!). Just two blocks from the Charles de Gualle Etoile metro station and easy walking distance to Arc de Triomphe, Champs-Elysees and the Eiffel Tower, we had no problem getting to some of the major Paris sights from Hidden. The hotel itself can't be more than two years old so everything is new and ultra modern - a nice juxtaposition to the old world look of the rest of the boulevards. The staff is exceptionally friendly, accommodating and speak English if you need. Our room, the Sensation Room, was beautiful and had the most comfortable bed and I believe the sheets and bed were made of bamboo which was amazing. The hotel/block its on are very quiet also. Breakfast in the morning is well worth it - all fresh, local farmer's market fare. I would love to come back to Paris and stay at this hotel. Lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room and bad location”
Reviews.Author: Joli-Coeur
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 1 night in october 2011 in an 'Inspiration' room. We arrived at Charles de Gaulle around 6 PM. We took the AF shuttle bus to the the city centre which took about an hour. The final stop is near the Arc de Triomphe. With 2 big travel cases and 2 handbags it's a long walk to this hotel. I think 15 minutes minimum. Even without the travel cases it's in my opinion not near the Arc the Triomphe. I really can't understand the hype about this hotel. Check in went smooth. The elevator is very small. When we came into our room it had a musty odour. The room was very small, too small. Fortunately for us we were there just to sleep. The coco mat bed was to hard. The bedding wasn't comfortable, it felt like soft sandpaper. The furniture was not painted to give one the so called back to basic nature feeling. We received complimentary champagne (half bottle Taitinger), some candies and a bottle of Vittel water. The bathroom was in fact in the room. They just put a shower cabin in the corner of the room, behind a wall. There was a rain shower though with a good pressure. The water leaked out of the douche cabin on the floor in front of the sink. The WC was in the smallest WC room I've ever seen...even smaller than the one of Sofitel Dubai. The tiny bar soap, the liquid soap and the body lotion were of their own brand, but a decent quality. We ordered some softdrinks via room service and the service was rapidly. We did not tried their breakfast. At the end I had the feeling like this hotel is literally basic (with nature in mind and organic food) with a price that can't justify the size and quality of the room. Next time I will not stay at this hotel anymore and I will look for a hotel that's closer to the Champs and that gives the quality that I pay for. JC

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect. Staff fabulous. Rooms small but beautiful. Breakfast amazing”
Reviews.Author: bethanylou
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to this hotel which did not dissapoint in any way. Quiet street so close to everything in Paris. What u see on the Internet is absolutely what it is like and is truly lovely

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and tasteful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: akiraoz
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here last week and were very satisfied. We had a double room with a bath tub. The room is tastefully decorated although a bit smaller side. The bed was very comfortable, room was quiet and good air conditioning/heating system so we were able to rest well. The location is a short walk from CDG Etoile and also other metro stops are close by. It is also very convenient from the airport as the Air France shuttle stops within a few minute walk from the hotel so no need to take a taxi or metro. There are fresh market and cafes nearby where you can get coffee and pastries in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Chris R
Reviews.Content: Perfect boutique hotel for a weekend escape with a great location only 5 mins walk from Metro and Champs Elysee. Very cool and stylish interiors throughout, the room was compact but very comfortable (101 with balcony and deck) with great rain shower. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Urban Calm”
Reviews.Author: dsm_99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hidden Hotel for 5 days in September. I had a quiet room with a terrace, and it was delightful. The staff was young, and among the friendliest I've ever encountered. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate; the cappuccino delicious. One of the best things about this hotel is that within a 5 minutes walk, you're either on a metro or at the very busy Champs. But the hotel and its surroundings were very quiet and peaceful. I would definitely stay again, and I would recommend it to couples or business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected excellence”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: The centre of Paris can be a bit hit and miss when it comes to quality but the Hidden Hotel is a true gem. Easily the best Paris hotel we have stayed in. Highly recommended for location, service and decor.

Reviews.Title: “The definition of a Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Addictedath
Reviews.Content: We visited with my husband this hotel in mid August. This is a different hotel in Paris! It has nothing to do with the traditional, baroque or Louis V decorated hotels we are used to. It is fresh, environmental friendly, alternative and not adressed to everybody. It should be a choice of open of flexible, environmental conscious people who are used to conceptual hospitality rather than the classic one ( I will not indicate ages as this depends on the personality of the person). When entering the hotel you find your self in a wooden relaxing ambience. The welcome was really warm and we were lucky to be upgraded to a room with a terrace! Very nice gesture that we appreciated! The rooms are really small. Even smaller from the regular small room that you expect to find in Paris; however the decoration, the bed and the linens were EXCELLENT! They have choosen to furnish the whole place with environmental friendly furniture ( COCO - Mat). The quality of sleep that you have compensates you for staying at 25m2! The breakfast is rich of healthy food with the highlight to be to preparing in front of you Smoothies with fresh food of your choice! Fresh bakery, local fromagerie and charcuterie gives you energy to go and experience Paris. In terms of location, it is very convenient: just 3 minutes walking from Arc de Triopmhe and Champs Elysee. I would strongly recommend this Hotel for an alternative stay in Paris, especially to young couples who are visiting regularly Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: ShrutiDesai
Reviews.Content: The staff were so friendly and ready to help! Very unique decor! Will definetely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, calm, and clean”
Reviews.Author: lsyves
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for the weekend. Am a hotel owner from another EU capital city and thought this hotel was wonderful. The hotel has an air of peace to it. The rooms are small but most in Paris are-and these are laid out better than most. The entire hotel was super clean. The staff were professional and helpful. The location was great. The breakfast was creatively displayed and looked delicious (we were there on business and didn't have time to eat). The design is pleasing to the eye and well thought out. My only complaints are that there was not good lighting in the room for anyone trying to do makeup, and our sink's faucet was high up and didn't move out of the way so washing my face was awkward. So, two very minor flaws is all I noticed. I will stay there any time I am in Paris and will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for our first Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: MacPete
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Hidden Hotel based on location, traveller reviews (thanks everyone!) and size. We felt it could better expose us to the true Paris, something a big chain hotel could not. We were right. From the moment we arrived (at 10am!) to drop the bags we were made welcome, greeted warmly everytime we passed the front desk or by any of the team. Steps to the Metro and Arc de Triomphe, the location is close to great patisseries and small cafes as well as our favourite discovery, a small local market where the cheese and pate are beyond description - perfect for a Paris picnic watching the Tour Eiffel light up from the Trocadero (go early for a good spot!) Ask at the desk for directions, I found it by accident and don't recall where it is - but it is no more than a 10 minute walk from the front door. Room 401 was very comfortable, quiet (despite construction next door) my only comment would be a very small WC which is made up from the raiin shower stall which is brilliant. Top marks for a great hidden gem in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: GlenForde
Reviews.Content: We loved our three nights in Paris at the Hidden Hotel. The room is small but perfectly formed with an indulgent wet room and sumptuous bed. The staff were friendly, efficient and very helpful. The breakfast was fantastic and wandering around the locale was great fun with loads of options for food, drink or just just soaking up the atmosphere of Paris a few minutes away from the Arc de Triomphe. Wifi that works which is so welcome after many hotels I have stayed advertise wifi that does not provide any service. Returning back each night to our cosy and stylish retreat made our short break so memorable and enjoyable, I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Quell horreur”
Reviews.Author: Conchitta11
Reviews.Content: I was meant to stay four nights at the Hidden Hotel, but after an incredibly horrid first day/night I had to move hotels. The reconstruction on the building next to the Hidden made it impossible to sleep morning or day. When I made my reservation I requested a quiet room. No one thought to contact guests to inform them that work was being done next door and that this may cause problems, or to put a notice on the hotels website... This would have prevented me a great deal of stress qnd inconvenience. Wednesay 7 Septembre I spent a great deal of time trying to sort this problem out, and as the manager had left for the day nothing was done. I requested that a message be left for him to inform him that I was not satisfied and that I would like to speak with him the following morning. After being woken up at 8heures du matin by the constant drilling and banging I dressed and went to the lobby and requested to speak with the manager; I was told he was on the phone and would be with me in five minutes. I sat down and waited for over TWENTY MINUTES for him, all the while I could hear him laughing on the telephone on what I can only assume was a personal call. When I did speak to him I found him rude and obnoxious and I was given the distinct impression that he could give a damn about me or the problem I was having. He even yelled at me, WHAT DO YOU WANT ME TO DO!! Eventually it was agreed I should move hotels. I provided my email address for him to correspond with me as I had a business luncheon to attend. Several of his emails were less than gracious and some were downright rude in demanding that I be back at the hotel and packed before 3heures apris midi. Of course this was impossible as my luncheon did not begin until 13:00. Perhaps if I had not been kept waiting so long to speak with him I could have packed prior to lunch and left my bad downstairs... Please let me make perfectly clear, that as someone who visitis Paris many times a year and who travels frequently for business that I have never had such a miserable experience with a hotel in my entire life. I am shocked and appalled by the experience I have had with the Hidden Hotel, and understand that what I have written is not even half of the nightmare that I encountered! As for the noise I speak of, imagine being in a room with several industrial drills going at full throttle and you will have an idea of what I speak of. In all my years of travel, I have never had to move hotels mid stay, then again I have never experienced such a disaster as I did this time in Paris. I can honestly say that the level of contempt and ineptitdue that I experienced has made this a completely memorable stay, yet for all of the wrong reasons. Throughout the entire ordeal not once did anyone apologise to me, though everyone acknowledged that the noise was horrific. I am certain that Mr Kelly the manager and the Hidden Hotel have provided others with a pleasurable experience, but on every conceivable level they failed miserably with me. I am not someone who looks to complain, I understand that any establishment can have an off day, it is how the faults are dealt with that matter, this is when the true essence of an establishment is revealed; unfortunately the Hidden don't seem to care enough about their brand or their customers than to be arrogant, contemptuous and snide. I only wish that the Hidden Hotel had stayed that way for me. Sincerely, Harold Finley

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: EmmaBBologne_France
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise anniversary weekend trip to Paris.. The hotel was amazing. We arrived at midday as the hotel had said we could leave our bags until our check in time..in fact our room was nearly ready, so we checked in and went to our room almost straight away. The decor, staff, room, comfy bed, shower, breakfast and philosophy etc, all made this a perfect choice for a stay in Paris. This is very central with Charles de Gaulle Etoile metro very close.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing cozy hotel with the soft atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: DariyaDee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hidden Hotel for 4 nights and we really enjoyed everything! Appartements are pretty small but so cozy and unique that you feel yourself very comfortable and... hidden!) And there are not so many of appartements in the whole hotel so most of the time you feel like the only person living there) The service is good, staff is friendly and polite. I especially liked the music in the lobby which completes the whole atmosphere. And for sure location is very convenient! It is close to the Arc of Triomphe and the Metro system and at the same time it's located on the quite street so you won't be annoyed with the crowd and big street's noise. The only thing I was upset about is the lack of refrigerator in our room. But I guess it's a question of the level of different rooms. Unfortunately we didn't have a chance to book another type of room because all of them have been already booked which means that the Hotel is known and popular. :) I will definitely advise this Hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “natural wonderfulness”
Reviews.Author: tcufaude
Reviews.Content: we stayed here their opening weekend....it was a really well designed hotel. i loved the use of textiles and earthy feel. the rooms are small, but very thought out in design. would definitely recommend for a shorter stay in paris. clean, modern, trendy. would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !”
Reviews.Author: eljay11
Reviews.Content: I was treated to a surprise b'day weekend and we stayed at the Hidden Hotel. It was a superb hotel with a very 'natural' theme. It had great decor, was comfortable, clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this to all of my friends. My boyfriend made a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it a lot and deifinately we will be back”
Reviews.Author: IlaryMartin
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a weekend and had great time. The Hotel is well centrally located,few minutes away from the Arc de Triomphe. We had the room with the balcony, very nice,clean, a little bit small but very nice. Service at the Hotel was excellent. They welcomed us with a complimentary bottle of champagne and helped us in every needs. Very freindly stuff! I will definately be back there next time I will be in Paris! Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, clean and cool with Champagne”
Reviews.Author: Ironing_Board
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently placed for Metro/RER and Arc de Triumph. But down a nice quiet street. Our room had a very comfortable bed and a wonderful powerful shower. It was clean, modern and stylish with a very good TV. We welcomed the half a bottle of champagne on arrival and dark curtains to keep the light out in the morning. The staff were bright and friendly and always helpful . The breakfast buffet is excellent. Highly recommended. Only negatives were an intermittently slow internet and quite an expensive price tag. ALso slightly surprised to return back after 4pm to find our room was just being serviced!

Reviews.Title: “funky - and well located”
Reviews.Author: HadP
Reviews.Content: Good stay - small rooms - interesting place Well located - fun vibe

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service, great people......”
Reviews.Author: lucglobe
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hidden Hotel. It is conveniently located close to everything you might need on vacation (pharmacy, dry cleaner, Air France car, etc...). The staff was VERY helpful and made us feel at home. Rooms are big for a European hotel. We'll be back for sure.....

Reviews.Title: “fantastic - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: brasing
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed there for 4 nights and loved it - rooms are on the small side but all hotel rooms in paris (that don't cost and arm+leg) are. We stayed at the intercontinental about 500mtrs away on Avenue Marceau for 2 nights (back end of a business trip) and there wasn't much difference in the room size and we paid 50% less at The hidden hotel. Look for deals or e-mail direct for good rates. Hotel staff were extremely freindly and the b'fast was great - pity we only tried it on the last day. Definately book again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but Really great choice.”
Reviews.Author: COtrips
Reviews.Content: Hidden Hotel lives up to its name. Some might say it's out of the way. Having never been to Paris i didn't know any better. To me it seems great: close to the subway, close to the Arc, easy access to the AirFrance Airport shuttle service. By the time i left, i thought the location was fantastic. Our rooms were not ready when we got there, but they stored the baggage and brought it to the room when it was ready since we were out. The room was very small, but it was set up really nice and the bed was definitely comfortable. This city is another one where i have to ask "am i really going to be spending that much time in the hotel?" When the answer is no, then who cares! They have a nice bar for drinks and an impressive breakfast spread, although we didn't sit to eat. If i go back to Paris, i will definitely consider coming back here. Some of the more interesting bakeries and eateries were in this district than what we walked into around the more popular areas.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldhereicome34
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel for people travelling to Paris. Location is great, staff is friendly, it's clean, rooms are nice and the breakfast is OK. What would you want more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...except for the bed.”
Reviews.Author: wellykiwi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a great reprieve for us after staying in an apartment to save some cash while we were in Paris. Service The staff spoke excellent English, so we were able to take a breather from hearing my appalling French for a bi, and it was great for getting directions on places to go and tips on the area. The staff were also incredibly nice, and that's saying a lot for staff in Paris, most are slightly off hand-ish and almost cold, (not in a bad way, it just seems that's the norm), but these guys were just lovely, no other way to describe them. Coffee: Order it in bed if you get a chance, the coffee was really really good, we found a lot of the cafes around served less-than-great coffee (I know, how is that possible, it's Paris isn't it?!) but these guys nailed it. The room: The room was awesome, very appealing to anyone interested in the minimalist look, and had a great tv with English speaking channels, a beautiful bathroom, but the problem lay with the bed. For all the beds at the hidden hotel, they use twin beds pushed together to form a queen, not unusual for a hotel, but in this case it really fails. My husband and I rolled together and joked in the morning about how we spent the night pull ourselves out of the abyss in the mattress, trying to get air. We were pretty high on life while we were there, so it didn't matter much, but if you were trying to get a good nights' sleep, say on business, or had a bad back, you would have a horrible time. Location: Great location, close to the Arc de Triumph and shopping, and about 20 minutes from de Louvre. The trick is writing down the route you take when you leave, because their alleyway is so tiny, it's not on most maps, making for a difficult time on your way back to the hotel. Overall, great stay, excellent value for money in Parisian terms (not excellent value for money in many other countries, but that's Paris for you), big spacious room, and friendly staff, just a shame about the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go...”
Reviews.Author: window_seat0
Reviews.Content: ... only because I want to keep it to myself! This was my 3rd stay at Hidden , and it is truly a small gem, as much as I hate to write this, just like when a good, relatively unknown restaurant you like gets good reviews, then it becomes harder to get a table... Elsa and her staff make you feel most welcome, in an unpretentious, but very professional way. The beds here are amazing. The rooms are mostly tiny, but very well laid out and extremely functional. On my first visit I even had an outdoor terrace. The "all natural" approach to the use of materials makes this a comfortable property for allergy-prone people, like me. I personally like the 17e, and proximity to Étoile, so that works nicely for me, and wether your are taking the Car Air France into town, or taxi, the Hidden is easily accessible. My only reservation is the cleanliness of the all-natural slate tiled showers. On my last visit, there was soap residue, and a slightly musty looking shower stall. I am assuming that eco-friendly cleaning products are used, and maybe harder to fully clean the tiles. That can (and I am sure will be) fixed. The 15 euro breakfast is not cheap, but still a good value with a good enough selection. Although I like the communal table, my only other small complaint is not letting guests use the front (street facing) tables... I find most people like their "space" in the morning, and being forced onto the communal table when more "solo" tables are readily available is a slight inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kazmacleod
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week in the hidden hotel and could not fault it in anyway. Was our anniversary and we were delighted to find a bottle of champagne in our room. Lovely touch! Rooms very very comfortable, location is great. Very convenient for port Maillot. Staff very friendly also. No complaints at all. It is also just that bit different which is great when you are used to staying in chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: BillStickers_7
Reviews.Content: Pros: Young, friendly, energetic, English-speaking staff. (For me the incredibly friendly staff was the highlight of this hotel.) Hotel on small quiet street with little outside noise. Great (but not free) breakfast, free wifi internet, trendy decor in lobby and rooms, nice location with lots of cafes,a short walk to Arch of Triumph and Argentine metro stop. Cons: Rooms very small. Noise can carry from other rooms and hallways. But because this is a small hotel there is not an endless stream of guests coming and going, and it doesn't take long for things to quiet down. No desk in room for work. No in-room safe. Rooms lack view of city ... if this is important to you stay at nearby Concorde Lafayette. Also, walk to Concord Lafayette for tickets for EUR 15 Air France shuttle to airport. If you're not fussy about room size Hidden Hotel is an absolutely fantastic choice for your visit to Paris. I'll stay there next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good Paris option, with slight hesitation”
Reviews.Author: LeFlaneur
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels in Paris and this is definitely a great option if you want to be in this part of town. Pros: - Very friendly staff - Good (free) internet access - Delicious breakfast buffet and a fantastic barrista for the morning coffee - Extremely quiet. Got a great night's rest. Cons: - Bed was comfortable but sheets could have been softer (they were maybe 100 threadcount?) - very European - Business travellers, be warned: there are only 3 irons in the whole hotel, and when I asked for one the evening I arrived, I was told they were all in use--and the staff had no idea where they were. I never got one, even the next day, so I ended up wearing a terribly wrinkled shirt to an important business meeting. Not cool. The staff helpfully suggested hanging it in the shower to steam (yes, i've travelled, I know that trick--but sometimes the wrinkles are beyond help). They were wholly unconcerned with tracking down their irons. So, on balance, excellent value and a good hotel, although probably better for people who don't have to wear suits or nicely pressed clothes as part of their trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service, perfect beds!”
Reviews.Author: stella_kro
Reviews.Content: The service was very friendly and polite, everybody spoke English, we asked to do our electronic check in for our flight and they provided us with a computer asap,plus printed out for us the boarding passes. The rooms are rather small, but that was not important for us since we were very satisfied with the wonderful bed and mattress. Hotel just 2-3 minutes away from Charles de Gaulle-Etoile metro station and Arc de Triomphe. Breakfast was excellent with fresh products.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel Hidden away near the Arc di Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: ksnyc
Reviews.Content: This feels more like a B&B then a hotel. Very welcoming. The lobby, sitting and eating area are all very nice. I had booked a single room by mistake and they had upgraded us to the next level at no extra cost. ( not sure how i did that) The rooms, like most in Paris are not big. But they are nicely appointed. A large bed that feels like a cocoon. A large granite rain shower and separate toilet area. Large TV on the wall and small desk space. Seriously, it is small, but you are not going to Paris to sit in your room all day. It's perfect for coming back to at night and waking up in. Hanging out in for a long period of time not so sure. It has a very spa like feel. The service is great and they are very accomodating. The breakfast was AMAZING. Sonya is a great Hostess! We eat a vegan diet and had not much luck with breakfast. Her's was filled with veggies and fruit and breads and they have amazing tea. In fact when we told her what we ate the next morning she had even more veggie options out. It's less then a 5 min walk to the nearest Metro Stop-CharlesDugall( carnot exit) and the Arc di Triopmhe. Also, for the airport on carnot there are Buses that go to and from both airports for 15 euro pp. Much better then taking the RER( don't do it) and less expensive then a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar service, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: TravelEatRepeat
Reviews.Content: This uber-modern hotel provided a great stay for our 6 nights in Paris. Staff are very friendly, helpful and most speak English fluently. Room was on the small side, typical for Europe. I booked an Intuition room. The website says the Intuition room has a smaller bed, so watch out for that. I asked to upgrade when we checked in and was told that we were actually given an Inspiration room with a larger bed. Our bed was comfortably large, thankfully. One thing that is really tiny is the water closet, it’s barely big enough to get up and down. A good size safe with a programmable electronic lock was provided. No iron or pants press though. Asked for an iron and was informed that there was only one and it was checked out, so I wore a lot of wrinkly clothes. Breakfast, though not include in the room rate, was excellent, consisting of a selection of high quality cured meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, juices, yogurts, and breads. Neighborhood is safe and 5 minute walk to metro CDG-Etoile on the famous line 1. Very close to Guy Savoy which I also highly recommend for a splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: auserLondon
Reviews.Content: Quirky, elegantly furnished boutique hotel with excellent staff. Cosy atmosphere, lovely natural textures everywhere. Friendly staff who go out of their way to make you feel at home. Lovely rooms, modern, comfortable, unique.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: HatsandJo
Reviews.Content: The directions on the website were a bit ropey, so took us 10 mins to find after coming out of the metro despite the fact it is just a 2 minute walk away. We were an hour early for check in but there was no problem and the room was ready. We had booked the Emotion Room and as many people have said, the rooms are small but everything you need is there and the shower is excellent (an overlooked necessity I always think). This room has a balcony area too. The view is awful but it almost doubles the space you have and is well worth it in glorious weather (as we were lucky enough to have). As we were on an anniversary visit someone had put a chilled half-size bottle of champagne in our room (free) which was a lovely touch and the room had a rustic/romantic feel which we appreciated. It might be a bit small for a week long trip but for a 3 day getaway it was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice in design but not as functional”
Reviews.Author: Aqua_swee
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after I read about the overwhelmingly positive feedback I read on Trip Advisor. Came with great expectation. But may say that we left less overwhelmed. Thumbs up - the location was great, BED and pillows ooooh so perfctly comfy, quality of breakfast +++, shower was EXCELLENT, staff very friendly and professional. Thumbs down- little walking space, little room for hanging clothes, miscommunication about free water, The size of the room was a MAJOR disappointment. Bumping into something within every 2-3 steps is no joy at all. We have to be creative in rearranging the furniture to create rooom for luggage. The bathroom is so small that the wall hangers for clothes had to be outside in order not to be wet. So imagine - after showering, you have to shiver to dash past a sink to reach for your towel and clothes. This spells poor design in our minds. Also disappointing was the "free water" promise. We booked the 3 night package that says "..come with free wi-fi, free water,..." Well, we get the wi fi free all through but upon chek out, we were told that the free water is only for the first night. This is utterly misleading. We surely were not prepared to pay 18 Euros for 4 bottles of water! Overall, it is nice. But not as nice as what we thought out to be

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Aliyina
Reviews.Content: My partner and I wanted to get away for a weekend as we needed privacy from the humdrum of our busy corporate lives. This hotel really was the epitome of perfection, total privacy and extroadinary service. Staff were professional and polite and always ready to help. Considering the range and assortment of rooms (the decor was expilicit) I would say the price is well worth it. We wanted to change room as we wanted something more contemporary (even though the room we were already in was lush) but to our surprise the staff were happy to refer us to a new room!!! The bar was splendor!!! We just loved staying at this hotel infact we will be back at the end of the month!!! I cannot praise this hotel enough love it! love it! love it!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, great location, spa like shower. Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelers804
Reviews.Content: The Hidden Hotel was a great choice for our time in Paris. It was in a great location, right near the Arc, Champs Elysees, and the underground. The room size was adequate, unlike other Paris hotel rooms that were heard were dreadfully small. Returning to our room after a long day of sight seeing, the shower was so relaxing and made us feel like our room was a private spa. For such a spa like bathroom, the towels were a little stiff rather than soft and fluffy as expected. However, the bath products smelled good and were soothing. The beds were comfortable and cozy. We loved the complimentary fruit in the lobby at all hours - cherries and apples. The staff spoke English well and provided maps and directions. The only negative, was the staff were not always correct on their directions. They suggested we take the Air France Line 2 from the airport, only to find out they were on strike when we arrived. They also gave incorrect directions to the Palace of Versailles. The hotel kept our luggage throughout the day after we checked out and offered us a room to freshen up in prior to our departure for the airport. We loved the Hidden Hotel and would recommend it to other couples traveling in Paris. We would stay at the Hidden again on a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended friendly staff unique design & perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cconsi
Reviews.Content: Hidden is hidden.........on a delightful small street 2 blocks from the Arc & Champs. Being in this location gives you the feel of living with the Parisennes as the facing windows and surrounding cafes are filled with them. The design of the hotel, despite being distinctly modern, is unique, warm and welcoming. The timber mixed with furs and slate is fresh- the hotel only having being completed in 2009. The room was small, but hey its Paris. Super comfortable bed, functional spaces and a great shower. Robby on the front desk welcomed my attempts and french speaking and was super helpful in directing us to neighbourhood conveniences and Paris sites. The local underground station is two blocks away and allows you to take in the Arc as you enter. This line takes you to the key locations in the Louvre and Marais. Breakfast served in the small lobby restaurant was oustanding and included traditional fare with modern touches all fresh, vibrant and tasteful. All in all my favourite boutique hotel experience to date.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is an excellent find for anyone.”
Reviews.Author: Bosco2579
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reccomended to me by a friend who stayed in Oct. I was travelling alone in Paris for the first time and found the staff to be extremely helpful. No matter if I needed directions or an explination they were always ready to help. My room was a nice size. I stayed in 601. Bed was super comfortable and there was really only noise in the morning afer 9am. The location was great . If you walk up a slight hill there was the Charles Degualle subway stop which connected you to most if not all the rail lines. A five to ten minute walk gets you the Champs. So many food options.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: MapleLeafMagic
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The staff were helpful in making dinner reservations for us. The room is small, but so are many in Europe. I wasn't sure about the mattress, but I got used to it. The soap disintegrates too easily, but the shower facility was great. A wide variety of cold dishes at breakfast - smoked salmon, cheeses, salami, prosciutto, baguette, fruit salad, nuts, pickles, cucumbers, tomatoes, yogurts - in little reusable ceramic pots. It was included in our room price and we enjoyed. This was the conference hotel for a meeting I had in the city and we booked it to stay an extra few days - it was a good decision. Convenient to the Metro & RER. The water closet/toilet facilities in the room were small. I found it quiet enough to sleep and I'm a light sleeper. Overall very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel for a special romantic weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mehLondon
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we wanted to stay in a very special place. I had heard and read of countless reviews of hotel rooms in Paris being small and cramped so I booked the largest Hidden had to offer. However, there was a muddle-up with the rooms and we ended up in one of their middle tier rooms. Regardless, the room we ended up in was more than sufficient for us. My wife didn't know where I had booked, so for what seemed like forever I was praying that the photos published by Hidden on their website were a true reflection of things to come! And, they were...much more..... Situated close to l'Arc de Triomphe, on entering the hotel we were greeted by what I would claim as one of the most welcoming staff in the hotel industry. The furniture, colour schemes and textures had the intended effect of creating a serene and cooling ambience on a hot Paris day - I suspect on a cold day it would give the opposite and desired effect. The hotel was abound by wood, leather and raw fabric setting it apart from most other hotels. The rooms we stayed in were particularly impressive - enough room for two and two medium luggage, a comfy 'coco' bed (see their website for full details), a lovely slate shower and a large flat screen TV. Only the separate toilet was a bit small for the long-limbed and wide-bottomed clientele, but we really didn't care as the intention was to spend as little time in there as possible! The staff deserves a dedicated paragraph in this review itself instead of a quick mention, as above. Everyone, including the cleaner, looked as though they wanted to be there and were conscious to make you feel comfortable. Smiling and having a helpful disposition ensured we could return to the hotel each evening and only remain frustrated at our lack of map reading skills and hours spent queuing at tourist locations - if there was a service they could provide to make our stay more comfortable they suggested it. Would we stay again? Of course - but now that I have ticked off Paris off my bucket list I would hope for Hidden to be less so and to expand to other countries!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hardpleased
Reviews.Content: Great location but can hear noise from the street below from front bedrooms - so ask for rooms at the back - other than that no problems would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: ezthermal
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the hidden hotel 14-20 June 2010. My wife and I looked through tripadvisor looking for a decent place in Paris with good tripadvisor ratings. I settled on the Hidden Hotel near the arch de triumph. My wife was a little worried about this "earth friendly - green" hotel. I told her to trust me... She loved it. Details - we had the small room type with a queen size bed. It is small - but most hotel rooms are small in Paris. This hotel was just opened a year ago - and all is new. I woke the second morning exclaiming to my wife how comfortable the bed was. She said she read it was some sort of coconut matting or something. All I know is it was the most comfortable I have slept in (we have the dense foam stuff at home. We have a king at home - was also worried about not enough room to flop around - but no problem. The air conditioning worked great and not too loud. HD TV in room (uh - in French). But who watches TV when in Paris??? Ok - the shower was probably worth the price of admission. Hand held and also rain shower overhead. Plenty of water pressure and Hot water. A place to sit - and plenty of room for two people... Ok - the hotel being green - they had some sort of organic small bar soap. Uh - bring you own deodorant (dial or Irish spring) for by 2PM each day - uh, I was aware I did not smell that good (no a problem at home. The toilet foes not have room to read the newspaper (to give you an idea of its size) - but, ..., enjoyed to extra space they left in the shower. There is continental breakfast each morning from 8 to 11. Was not until day three that we realized that we being charged 15 Euro per person for the experience (was not included in our expedia package). But - upon reflection, my wife and both agreed we could not do better somewhere else. Coffee, FRESH fruits, avocados, nuts, cheese, yogurt, bread, fruit smoothies, dried fruit, cereals, FRESH squeezed juices, assortment of thin sliced meat. We did not need to eat again until late in the day. The ladies working the small breakfast area were very nice and helpful. That said (I am typing this on my blackberry on the flight back - so no particular order) EVERY employee of the hotel was VERY nice. Read THAT in all the other hotel reviews. Oh - and wireless internet at no charge - worked great in our room. Location was excellent - near metro. Oh - by the way - my wife dragged me to the moulon rouge show. It is expensive - so I was a bit reluctant to go see a burlesque show (funny how it was the women pushing to go). Some of our friends had gone a couple weeks earlier - so - no way out. Ask the hotel to reserve the 7pm dinner followed by show at 9. If hotel makes reservations - you get better seating. The hotel charged 16 euro to reserve for us - bit the actual price was reduced by about that amount by the rouge. You do not need to rush to get there at 7 as you have assigned seats - not sure how it was done. We had a table next to the stage - wow. Short version is it must not be missed - I thought it was over a couple times. The show was fantastic. And of course my 50 something year old (and beautiful of course) wife loved it - "very tastefully done". The Sacre Couer church on top of the hill was cool. BUT - behind it (on its level) to the left you will find a large square FILLED w artist. We saw no artist anywhere else in town. Also - many wandering around doing portraits. You have to see it. Ok - if you do not want to be treated rudely by employees of your hotel, and want a nice place - the hidden hotel has it. And you can get a beer or mixed drink at their small bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , Great Location , Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: davegorwill
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hidden hotel on the 15th june 2010 to spend our honeymoon in Paris , we have never been abroad before so didnt really know what to expect , so we went on reviews of the Hidden Hotel and they lived up to the hype. The top thing about this Hotel is that the staff are brillaint , they never mind to help out with directions best routes and best hangouts for shopping or bars , there knowledge of the area was flawless , if it was not for the staff we would not have tried the metro but thanks to the staff if made our lives so much easier. The location is great its down a quite side street but only a 3 minture walk away and you at the Arc de Triomphe and top of the Champs Elysees so you are always close for food and drinks. The bar area / breakfast area are really relaxed and you could spend hours down there chatting to the bar staff and reception staff as were always happy to sociallise with us. I would like to say a great THANKYOU to the night receptionist man , i didnt get his name but originally from sweden i think , but was always happy to chat from 8pm and even when we got back late , also the barman who was there later on Please contact me if you have any questions about the hotel.. we will defantly be going back to this hotel!!!!!! thanks to all the team at the Hidden Hotel Dave and Terri

Reviews.Title: “Excelent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Hilbis
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and professional staff, the location is unbeatable, few blocks from Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees and still quiet and peaceful. The rooms are spacious for Paris, normally rooms are very small in this city, the bed it's the most comfortable bed we had got in Paris and we love the environmentally friendly architecture . We forgot and item at the Hotel and the staff contact us and where very helpful, they even shipped out the item for free.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 71reviewer71
Reviews.Content: fantastic enterieur, nice staff, perfect location, eye for detail

Reviews.Title: “For sure we'll stay in this hotel for our next visit in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Pdg_1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time in Paris while staying at this hotel. There are 3 main reasons why we love this place: 1) the location – it was steps away from the Champs Elysees and a Metro station; 2) the atmosphere – the room was efficiently designed and tastefully decorated (we stayed in the Emotion Room which had a cozy private terrace). The lobby was also comfortable and welcoming, and played a great selection of music; and 3) the staff – warm, courteous, helpful, and they really made an effort to take care of their guests. Neither of us speaks French. So we were a bit worry at the beginning, but it wasn’t a problem at all with our stay. The breakfast was also excellent. Overall, we really can’t find a bad thing to say about this hotel, and this doesn’t happen often.

Reviews.Title: “Nice natural feel”
Reviews.Author: LatPat
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend visited Paris after a long long journey from Amsterdam (long story) but arrived into Paris at 2am very tired. Arriving by taxi we went straight past Arc de triomphe (amazing sight at night) and arrvied at the hotel just 30 seconds away. The hotel took great care of us upon our arrival and were very welcoming. Aalthough our room was quite small (typical for a Parisian hotel of this style) they are really comfortable and have a nice calming feel to their decor. I would recommend this hotel for couples not familys who are on a romantic trip, good location to most top attractions. Just one more note - Take good notice of the roads features as this area all seems very confusing until you get your bearings!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely design hotel on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: AngelosLondon
Reviews.Content: Blink and you will miss it. This hotel is conveniently situated, a little bit different from the usual chain hotels prevalent in this area and has extremely comfortable beds. Free wifi is always a bonus - although as I have mentioned in several reviews should be de facto in any hotel worth its salt. My grope, if you can call it that was that there was no chair in the room so I made use of a pouffe. Not too bad but certainly didn't work as well as a chair. The room I stayed in had a bedroom / shower /sink literally in the same room. It was a great use of space and the room, though modest didn't feel cramped. A real problem in Paris. Quality slippers and bathing products with good water pressure made staying here a pleasure. Friendly staff topped off this little gem

Reviews.Title: “It’s a hidden gem, excellent hotel, worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: kirka35
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Paris on my birthday and we stayed in Hidden hotel over the weekend. Neither of us have been in this hotel before but my husband picked it since he knows I like green hotels so he read that Hidden hotel is considered as green hotel To start with its in an excellent location 3 minutes walk from The Arc de Triomphe, on one of the tiny, little streets of the Paris. When taxi dropped us in front of the hotel there was no door man and I thought that it’s a cute little moms and paps place not more. When I entered the lobby I was pleasantly surprised with the deep earthy, organic, raw beauty of the design. The girl in front desk was dressed in organic, beige cotton loose pants and a vest with no make up and loose curly hair, the same type of outfit I saw on another stuff member. It was such a relaxing look unlike the tight, strict business suits and an ugly neck scarves that every other hotel stuff is forced to wear. But the most amazing is yet to come! When we checked in and went to our room it was unbelievable!!!!! A huge bed with beige/creamy organic cotton leanings, a white canapé over the bed. The sink was made from a big natural rock! OMG just go and stay the best romantic hotel I have ever been, and I have stayed in Four Seasons, and Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, friendly atmosphere, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: MrStorm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hidden Hotel for four nights in February and the hotel comes with our highest recommendations! The staff and owner at the hotel were quick to greet us upon arrival and the service was excellent and kind for our entire stay. The Exception room in which we stayed was spacious and elegantly decorated in natural, clean and stylish materials and the bed was soft but good. The breakfast at the hotel also deserves mentioning with great bread, meats and cheeses. All in all a wonderful stay at the hotel, and we will surely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: Citybreaktraveller1
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, in a great location and certainly not one to be missed. Having just come back from a weekend away in Paris having stayed at the Hidden Hotel i cannot recommend it enough. The service and advice were fantastic, the receptionist could not have been more helpful, the recommendation for the Metro station to come off for the best view of the Eiffel tower was great (Trocadero) The restaurant recommendations were also very good, if visiting you must try the publicist drugstore (concept 24 hr shop and restaurant on the Champs-Elysees) The room although not very large had a very romantic feel to it, we had room 101 which had a private balcony. all in all fantastic weekend break

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, great service, genuine hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: Ldn_Global
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a colleague for a two day trip and it was a real joy. We didn't stay in the cheapest rooms - I believe they are quite small but very nice - we had the next one up, think its called Emotion. Much more personal and natural feeling than a standard hotel room with beautiful wooden floors, natural stone sink and bed in the centre of the room with an incredibly comfy mattress. Cute treats in the rooms too - natural sweets. Quite rooms even next to teh lift because there are only a couple of rooms on each floor. Great shower and bath room facilities. Snug bar and a great breakfast. Service was lovely too. A new regular for Paris trips.

Reviews.Title: “Gloriously comfortable, exceptionally friendly concierge”
Reviews.Author: bluelight_solutions
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed at the superb Five Hotel, we thought that it was going to be impossible to top. The Hidden Hotel, though, managed it! Unlike the Five Hotel, the Hidden Hotel is not fashionably trendy, but has an earthly, rustic feel that instantly puts you at ease. The room was light and airy, and the much-loved "cocomat" bed made it feel like heaven. It was a pleasure staying at this place, especially with the staff being so friendly and helpful, always finding us things to do and places to go. We definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “a perfect hidden hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: meringo
Reviews.Content: When I arrived in the hotel, I thought the location was perfect. It is comfortably hidden in one of the small street, yet it is so near to Arc de Triomphe. So in terms of location I couldn't ask for more. I booked the hotel when there was a promotional rate going on, I got a good deal. So, I feel the rate that they offered for a hotel in Paris was very reasonable and definitely a "get"! The room was quite small for a Paris standard, so it feels a little bit cramped, but it was nicely decorated. It has a natural touch with fibery straw feeling, the concept of the hotel is to bring you back to the nature, which I feel they did a good job. Also, the bed was very comfortable for my bad back. I didn't eat any meal in the hotel, so I can't comment on that one. Check in and check out process was also very efficient, I had an early flight in the morning of checking out, so the nite before I asked the receptionist to book me a cab in the morning, which was done so without fail. So, I was pretty satisfied with their service. The only thing that I need to point out was, when we reached the hotel to check in, there was nobody helping us to carry our bags to the lobby, so we had to carry our own bags to the lobby and room....so that was a minus point from my point of view. Although my review in general sounds good, but I will still give this hotel a rate of 3 out of 5.The reason is, personally I feel they are good for Paris standard, but compare to hotels in Asia, they are far behind, and being a traveller around Asia a lot, I prefer to compare hotels to hotels rather than relatively to the place per se.

Reviews.Title: “FOUND: Best hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: twoboosDublin
Reviews.Content: The Hidden Hotel is an experience! The location is extremely convenient and the staff are fantastic. Our room was stunning, with a rain shower and really comfortable bed! It was clean and quite and soooooo relaxing! The organic ethos and environmental message run through the whole place and the results design wise are mind blowing.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Jewel in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Florisse
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this great hotel for three days while on a business trip. The ecologic atmosphere breaths in every corner of this lovely hotel. From the wooden facade outside to the jute interior of the elevator until the comfortable coco mat beds and the bio yogurt at breakfast. Friendly staff at the front desk and 24 hour service. The hotelmanager even let me use her laptop to check my messages! I will certainly recommend this hotel to family, friends and colleagues because it is only a 5 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and boomimg Champs but you don't hear a sound in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and very comfortable rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: norman23
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for the end of the Tour de France and stayed at the Hidden Hotel for 2 nights. The hotel was easy to get to from Gare Du Nord via metro and a short walk. On arrival we found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. Ourthe room was clean, the bed very comfortable and although the room was small all the facilities were available. The breakfasts were very nice and although there was no restuarant the local area has a number of bars and eating places. We really enjoyed our stay at the Hidden Hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--Small Room”
Reviews.Author: wtliving
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hidden Hotel in Sept. 2009 for three nights. This is a nice hotel in a great neighborhood. The hotel is very near the Arc and Metro/RER stop nearest the Arc. The service at the hotel was friendly and the rooms were well appointed. Our bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet, dark and cool. My only negative comment is that the room was smal for the rate we paid. The bathroom configuration was the toilet in one room and the shower in another. The toilet room was so small my knees hit the wall ( I am 6' 4"). The shower was a rain shower and was great. While I enjoyed the loacation and the decor of the hotel, I would stay somewhere else next time. There are better values in Paris where you can stay in a good neighborhood in a larger room for less money. We stayed at the Eiffel Seine on our way back from Provence and found the room to be larger and less expensive. The neighborhood was different buy equally as good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: JulesMcC78
Reviews.Content: I've just spent 4 nights at the Hidden Hotel and I loved it. I attended a congress at the Palais which is a easy 10 min walk from the door along Avenue des Ternes. The hotel was an excellent escape at the end of the day, it sits on a quiet street not clearly shown on the map and sits nestled in the area where Avenue des Ternes meets Avenue Mac Mahon. The staff were really friendly and happy to help with any request that I had, nothing seemed too much trouble. I stayed in an intuition room (not the largest but in proportion and it's Paris so not many rooms are particularly big) which I think was the base room, but totally ideal for someone travelling on their own with everything you would need. I like to look out for the smaller boutique styled places and Hidden ticked the boxes. Calming lavender on the super comfy coco mat bed, surrounded in muslin and a great shower housed in slate, lovely! If you're travelling to Paris for fun then again the location is excellent, round the corner from the Arc de Triomphe and the metro line at Charles de Gaulle, Etoile which will take you to many other great areas in the city. A really lovely stay and I enjoyed getting back there each night! Would certainly stay again, in fact I look forward to it!!

Reviews.Title: “A real oasis in a great location....serving good coffee”
Reviews.Author: ScandinavianTraveler
Reviews.Content: We are a familiy of 4 wth 2 children between 8 and 11, and booked 2 rooms. The atmosphere in the room was fantastic as they were brand new, natural, clean and very fresh, unique, and some functionality sacrificed for design but very little. Location was great with little grocery shops very close by, the children absolutely loved staying there. The carved wooden chairs were unique, the breakfast was plentiful, tasty and tastefully setup, with a wonderful lady serving proper coffee and hot chocolate. I have already recommended this hotel to just about everyone. This is not a touristy type hotel where you will have "everything" as you would have at home at your fingertips, but for a Parisian hotel where you may expect just about anything, this stay was a unique surprise and an event on its own. The value was exceptional as we found this on a special offer shortly after it opened.

HotelInfo.Name: Hidden Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 28, rue de l'Arc de Triomphe, 75017 Paris, France
